title: Bibliophile
flavorText: Ten books by the same author. At this point you're funding their coffee habit personally.
trigger: Finish 10 books by the same author.

title: Multi-talented
flavorText: The author narrated their own book. Bold. Intimate. Slightly unhinged.
trigger: Finish a book that is narrated by the author.

title: Superfan
flavorText: Five books by the same author. You're not obsessed. You're 'consistent.'
trigger: Finish 5 books by the same author.

title: 2:00 AM: Poor Life Choices
flavorText: You listened past 2 AM on a weeknight. Tomorrow-you is furious. The System is delighted.
trigger: User has any listening session that reaches = 2:00 AM America/New_York, where the local day is Monday - Friday.

title: Novella Collector
flavorText: Five short books down. You're basically speedrunning literature.
trigger: Finish 5 books that are under 5 hours long.

title: Short & Sweet
flavorText: You finished a book under 3 hours. Quick. Clean. Suspiciously efficient.
trigger: Finish a book that is under 3 hours long.

title: The Epic
flavorText: You finished a book longer than 50 hours. The System has no reward worthy of this. It offers trauma instead.
trigger: Finish a book that is over 50 hours long.

title: The Long Haul
flavorText: You finished a book longer than 30 hours. That wasn't a book. That was a hostage situation.
trigger: Finish a book that is over 30 hours long.

title: 20 books
flavorText: Twenty books finished. You now have opinions on narrators you've never met. The System approves of your confidence.
trigger: Finish 20 audiobooks total.

title: Century Club
flavorText: One hundred books finished. At this point the System isn't rewarding you. It's documenting you.
trigger: Finish 100 books total.

title: First Word
flavorText: You finished your first audiobook. The System is proud. Don't get used to it.
trigger: Finish your first audiobook.

title: Five-Pack
flavorText: Five books down. You're not addicted. You're 'committed.' That's what the addicts say.
trigger: Finish 5 books total.

title: Gold Scholar
flavorText: Fifty books. Your brain is now 12% audiobook and 88% opinions. The System approves. Reluctantly.
trigger: Finish 50 books total.

title: Silver Scholar
flavorText: Twenty-five completions. That's not 'a phase.' That's a lifestyle choice.
trigger: Finish 25 books total.

title: The Decade
flavorText: Ten books. You've formed a habit. The System suggests you stop pretending otherwise.
trigger: Finish 10 books total.

title: 1 series
flavorText: You finished an entire series. The System marks it 'cleared' and immediately offers you three more.
trigger: Finish 1 complete series.

title: 15 series
flavorText: Fifteen series. That's not dedication. That's a condition. The System recommends sunlight.
trigger: Finish 15 complete series.

title: 2 series
flavorText: Two series down. You're officially the kind of person who says, 'I'll just start the next one.' The System smiles.
trigger: Finish 2 complete series.

title: 20 series
flavorText: Twenty series finished. You've lived multiple lifetimes and still have backlog. The System nods knowingly.
trigger: Finish 20 complete series.

title: 25 series
flavorText: Twenty-five series. You've crushed more arcs than most editors. The System fears your momentum.
trigger: Finish 25 complete series.

title: 50 series
flavorText: Fifty series completed. You are the endgame content. The System offers you a throne made of bookmarks.
trigger: Finish 50 complete series.

title: Serial Listener
flavorText: Five series completed. The System is updating your title to: 'Problematic.'
trigger: Finish 5 complete series.

title: Series Master
flavorText: Ten series completed. You don't finish stories. You hunt them.
trigger: Finish 10 complete series.

title: Committed
flavorText: One hundred hours listened. That's a part-time job you volunteered for.
trigger: Reach 1 hours of total listening time.

title: Deep Diver
flavorText: Five hundred hours. You've been listening long enough to develop plot-based instincts.
trigger: Reach 500 hours of total listening time.

title: The Chronicler
flavorText: A thousand hours of listening. The System would give you a medal, but it spent the budget on traps.
trigger: Reach 1,000 hours of total listening time.

title: Catching Up
flavorText: You completed a series with more than ten books. The System calls this 'endurance.' Your friends call it 'a cry for help.'
trigger: Finish a series that has more than 10 books.

title: Completionist Junior
flavorText: Three books. One arc. Zero restraint. The System awards you a small victory and a bigger temptation.
trigger: Finish a trilogy.

title: Narrator Junkie
flavorText: Ten books by the same narrator. You don't listen to books. You listen to a person.
trigger: finish 10 books by the same narrator

title: Series Starter
flavorText: Five different series started. You are one bad decision away from 40 unfinished arcs.
trigger: Finish the first book of 5 different series.

title: Side Quest
flavorText: You completed a series with exactly two books. The System respects efficient obsession.
trigger: Finish a series with exactly 2 books.

title: The Completionist
flavorText: You finished an entire series. The System marks it as 'cleared' and immediately offers you three more.
trigger: Finish all books in a single series.

title: Voice of Reason
flavorText: Five books with the same narrator. That voice lives in your head now. Rent-free.
trigger: finish 5 books by the same narrator

title: 1% Lifesteal
flavorText: You drained every last hit point the apocalypse had to offer. The system would call the police... if anyone were still alive.
trigger: Complete all books in 1% Lifesteal

title: A Learning Experience
flavorText: You skipped orientation and jumped straight to founding a civilization with stolen alien tech. Bold. Possibly illegal. Definitely impressive.
trigger: Complete all books in A Learning Experience

title: A Shrouded World
flavorText: You survived being kidnapped by reality itself and dropped somewhere that actively hates you. The system calls that 'character building.'
trigger: Complete all books in A Shrouded World

title: A Touch of Power (Siphon)
flavorText: You siphoned your way through an entire world while pretending you weren't terrifying. The gods noticed. They're pretending they didn't.
trigger: Complete all books in A Touch of Power (Siphon)

title: After It Happened
flavorText: You endured the end of the world with British efficiency and a shocking lack of tea. Civilization collapsed. You didn't.
trigger: Complete all books in After It Happened

title: All the Skills
flavorText: You acquired every ability and still felt unprepared. The System confirms this is normal.
trigger: Complete all books in All the Skills

title: Alpha LitRPG
flavorText: You endured experimental mechanics, questionable balance, and raw chaos. Congratulations. You survived early access.
trigger: Complete all books in Alpha LitRPG

title: Alpha Physics
flavorText: Reality installed a new ruleset and you didn't uninstall yourself. Family reunited. Physics exploited.
trigger: Complete all books in Alpha Physics

title: Anomalies
flavorText: You stared directly into unexplained phenomena and kept listening anyway. Curiosity did not kill this cat. Somehow.
trigger: Complete all books in Anomalies

title: Apocalypse Cultivation
flavorText: You cultivated power while everything burned. Multitasking achieved.
trigger: Complete all books in Apocalypse Cultivation

title: Apocalypse Parenting
flavorText: You raised children during the apocalypse. That's it. That's the achievement.
trigger: Complete all books in Apocalypse Parenting

title: Arise
flavorText: You combined military discipline with self-replicating murder tech. The monsters never stood a chance.
trigger: Complete all books in Arise

title: Ascend Online
flavorText: You didn't just play the game. You built the endgame. Other players still complain about you on forums.
trigger: Complete all books in Ascend Online

title: Awaken Online
flavorText: You leaned into the darkness, optimized it, and called it strategy. The NPCs are terrified. The system is delighted.
trigger: Complete all books in Awaken Online

title: Bad Luck Charlie (The Dragon Mage)
flavorText: You were born unlucky, raised unlucky, and somehow weaponized it. The universe tried to kill you. You made it awkward.
trigger: Complete all books in Bad Luck Charlie (The Dragon Mage)

title: Battle Mage Farmer
flavorText: You retired to farm life and immediately optimized it with violence. The land is fertile. The neighbors are afraid.
trigger: Complete all books in Battle Mage Farmer

title: Bobiverse
flavorText: You copied yourself until the universe ran out of RAM. Humanity survived. Mostly because of your personality disorder.
trigger: Complete all books in Bobiverse

title: Challenger's Call
flavorText: You accepted challenges no one sane would. The System stopped offering easy mode.
trigger: Complete all books in Challenger's Call

title: Chaos Seeds (The Land)
flavorText: You punched trees, named a village, and somehow became a god. The patch notes still reference you.
trigger: Complete all books in Chaos Seeds (The Land)

title: Chrysalis
flavorText: You died, reincarnated as an insect, and immediately chose violence. Evolution approves of your enthusiasm.
trigger: Complete all books in Chrysalis

title: Completionist Chronicles
flavorText: You didn't save the world efficiently. You saved it thoroughly.
trigger: Complete all books in Completionist Chronicles

title: Cradle
flavorText: You cultivated, advanced, ascended, and still asked, 'What's next?' The heavens regret answering.
trigger: Complete all books in Cradle

title: Defiance of the Fall
flavorText: You stared down the System, ignored its plans, and optimized anyway. Defiance registered. Consequences pending.
trigger: Complete all books in Defiance of the Fall

title: Divine Dungeon
flavorText: You became a building and immediately started murdering adventurers. Property values have never been higher.
trigger: Complete all books in Divine Dungeon

title: Dungeon Crawler Carl
flavorText: You saved the world because of a cat. A talking, magical cat. Princess Donut accepts your awkward leadership. The System just accepts your survival.
trigger: Complete all books in Dungeon Crawler Carl

title: Dungeon Lord
flavorText: You didn't raid the dungeon. You ran it. The heroes never stood a chance.
trigger: Complete all books in Dungeon Lord

title: Dungeon Robotics
flavorText: You replaced traps with algorithms and adventurers with data points. Efficiency achieved. Ethics not found.
trigger: Complete all books in Dungeon Robotics

title: Eight
flavorText: You survived with fewer rules, fewer resources, and fewer safety nets. The System is quietly impressed.
trigger: Complete all books in Eight

title: Ether Collapse
flavorText: You lived through the consequences of magical industrialization. OSHA does not exist here.
trigger: Complete all books in Ether Collapse

title: Everybody Loves Large Chests
flavorText: You trusted nothing, murdered everything, and were absolutely correct. The system is uncomfortable with how much you enjoyed it.
trigger: Complete all books in Everybody Loves Large Chests

title: Full Murderhobo
flavorText: You solved every problem with violence and called it roleplay. The System sighs.
trigger: Complete all books in Full Murderhobo

title: He Who Fights With Monsters
flavorText: You talked too much, punched gods, and somehow made friends. The monster inside you says hi.
trigger: Complete all books in He Who Fights With Monsters

title: Heaven's Laws
flavorText: You followed the rules of heaven just long enough to break them properly. The System calls this progress.
trigger: Complete all books in Heaven's Laws

title: Infinite Realm
flavorText: You refused to choose one progression system. The System made a note.
trigger: Complete all books in Infinite Realm

title: Iron Prince (Warformed)
flavorText: You trained, suffered, adapted, and broke every metric. The academy will be adjusting its expectations.
trigger: Complete all books in Iron Prince (Warformed)

title: Jake's Magical Market
flavorText: You sold loot, broke economies, and survived cosmic nonsense. The free market endures. Somehow.
trigger: Complete all books in Jake's Magical Market

title: Limitless Lands
flavorText: You used experience, discipline, and war crimes to win a game. The System did not plan for this.
trigger: Complete all books in Limitless Lands

title: Mark of the Fool
flavorText: You were told you were useless and made it everyone else's problem. The System respects spite.
trigger: Complete all books in Mark of the Fool

title: Master Hunter K
flavorText: You ignored teamwork and optimized lethality instead. The monsters never unionized.
trigger: Complete all books in Master Hunter K

title: Mother of Learning
flavorText: You died, reset, learned, and optimized until reality gave up. The System stopped counting attempts.
trigger: Complete all books in Mother of Learning

title: Noobtown
flavorText: You hacked the tutorial zone, rebuilt civilization, fought pirates, and negotiated with badgers. Achievement unlocked: tutorial actually completed.
trigger: Complete all books in Noobtown

title: Nova Terra
flavorText: You played a game that refused to stay a game. Customer support is unavailable.
trigger: Complete all books in Nova Terra

title: Portal to Nova Roma
flavorText: You arrived with future tech and conquered politely. History will complain later.
trigger: Complete all books in Portal to Nova Roma

title: Primal Hunter
flavorText: You ignored society, embraced murder, and optimized survival. The System quietly marked you as ''concerning.'
trigger: Complete all books in Primal Hunter

title: Reborn: Apocalypse
flavorText: You remembered the end of the world and decided to do better. The System noticed. It's annoyed.
trigger: Complete all books in Reborn: Apocalypse

title: Savage Dominion
flavorText: You solved progression with violence and refused to apologize. The System considers this efficient.
trigger: Complete all books in Savage Dominion

title: Shadow Sun
flavorText: You watched civilization collapse and adapted faster than most people would prefer. The sun dimmed. You did not.
trigger: Complete all books in Shadow Sun

title: Shadowcroft Academy for Dungeons
flavorText: You enrolled in a school where failure means death. Graduation rates remain 'selective.'
trigger: Complete all books in Shadowcroft Academy for Dungeons

title: Sky Realms Online
flavorText: You conquered floating worlds and airborne nonsense. Physics filed a complaint.
trigger: Complete all books in Sky Realms Online

title: Solo Leveling
flavorText: You leveled alone, broke scaling, and became a problem. Balance no longer applies to you.
trigger: Complete all books in Solo Leveling

title: Spellheart
flavorText: You bound power directly to your survival. Stress tests failed. Repeatedly.
trigger: Complete all books in Spellheart

title: Spellmonger
flavorText: You juggled magic, politics, logistics, and existential threats. Turns out spellcasting is the easy part.
trigger: Complete all books in Spellmonger

title: Spellmonger: Hawkmaiden
flavorText: You followed the side quest that somehow became a main campaign. The skies are secure. Mostly.
trigger: Complete all books in Spellmonger: Hawkmaiden

title: Spellmonger: Legacy
flavorText: You learned that legacies are messy and power never comes clean. The System approves of the paperwork.
trigger: Complete all books in Spellmonger: Legacy

title: Spellmonger: Shadowmage
flavorText: You navigated intrigue with magic sharp enough to cut through politics. The shadows noticed.
trigger: Complete all books in Spellmonger: Shadowmage

title: Station 64 (The Doll Dungeon)
flavorText: You ignored every warning sign and continued anyway. The dungeon remembers your bravery. And your screams.
trigger: Complete all books in Station 64 (The Doll Dungeon)

title: Street Cultivation
flavorText: You cultivated in a world that runs on rent and regret. Balance achieved. Temporarily.
trigger: Complete all books in Street Cultivation

title: Super Powereds
flavorText: You survived college with superpowers and emotional damage. Statistically improbable.
trigger: Complete all books in Super Powereds

title: System Apocalypse
flavorText: The System arrived. Society didn't make it. You adapted. Aggressively.
trigger: Complete all books in System Apocalypse

title: The Bad Guys
flavorText: You chose profit over morals and somehow improved the world. The System shrugs.

title: The Completionist Chronicles
flavorText: You refused to leave content unfinished. The System ran out of side quests.
trigger: Complete all books in The Completionist Chronicles

title: The Divine Apostasy
flavorText: You questioned divinity, optimized magic, and kept moving. The gods are uncomfortable.

title: The Good Guys
flavorText: You tried to do the right thing. Collateral damage occurred.

title: The Grand Game
flavorText: You didn't ask to play. The System didn't care.
trigger: Complete all books in The Grand Game

title: The Infinite World
flavorText: You learned what you were, where you were, and why that was bad. Understanding achieved. Safety not included.

flavorText: You applied math to magic and made reality uncomfortable. Peer review is pending.

flavorText: You cultivated power, destiny, and an unforgettable alias. The System will never stop judging it.

flavorText: You climbed tiers, broke ceilings, and refused to slow down. The System updated its expectations.

title: The Perfect Run
flavorText: You died repeatedly until reality behaved itself. The System refuses to comment.

flavorText: You min-maxed so hard the forums are still arguing about it. The System doesn't care. The comments section does.

title: The Ten Realms
flavorText: You brought tactics, logistics, and discipline to immortality. The heavens were unprepared.

flavorText: You thought it was cozy. The world disagreed.

flavorText: You fought wars while unconscious and still showed up to work. Capitalism applauds your suffering.

flavorText: You broke limits the System explicitly asked you not to. Warnings were issued. You ignored them.

flavorText: You made the afterlife look like a productivity seminar. The System took notes.

flavorText: You played the long game while everyone else chased DPS. The world ended. Your save file didn't.

flavorText: You endured puns, magic, and questionable narrative decisions. The System grants you emotional resilience.

title: Mutual Book Trauma
flavorText: You have at least one completed book in common with every other user. Congratulations. You've built a library-shaped social graph.
trigger: For user U, for every other user V: completed(U) n completed(V) ?

title: Dragon Rider
flavorText: You finished a book with 'Dragon' in the title. The System rates your survival odds as 'funny.'
trigger: Finish a book with 'Dragon' in the title.

title: Interstellar
achievement: In Space, Nobody Can Hear You Binge
flavorText: You finished a book with 'Space,' 'Galaxy,' or 'Star' in the title. The vacuum of space has nothing on your attention span.
trigger: Finish a book with 'Space,' 'Galaxy,' or 'Star' in the title.

title: Magic User
flavorText: You finished a book with 'Mage' or 'Wizard' in the title. The System grants you +1 smugness.
trigger: Finish a book with 'Mage' or 'Wizard' in the title.

title: Author Collector
flavorText: Five authors. Five voices. Infinite backlog.
trigger: Finish books by 5 different authors

title: Eclectic Reader
flavorText: You refuse to read the same voice twice.
trigger: Finish books by 10 different authors

title: Binge Listener
flavorText: Just one more chapter turned into half your day.
trigger: Any single listening session lasts at least 5 hours

title: Extreme Binger
flavorText: Sleep is optional. The story is not.

title: Weekend Marathon
flavorText: Weekends are for rest. You chose story.

title: Page Turner
flavorText: You started it. You finished it. You slept later.

title: Pointy Hat Approved
flavorText: Magic detected. Hat optional.

title: Habit Forming
flavorText: Three days in a row. The routine has begun.
trigger: Listen on 3 consecutive days

title: Daily Listener
flavorText: Seven days straight. The story owns your schedule now.

title: Monthly Grind
flavorText: Twenty days in a month. Consistency beats motivation.

title: Main Character Syndrome
flavorText: You dont read authors. You live in their backlog.

title: Backlog Resident
flavorText: At this point you should pay rent.

flavorText: You dont follow authors. You pledge allegiance.

flavorText: At this point, youre their unpaid marketing team.
